item.title: Useful bspwm Shorcuts
item.author: dajhub
item.description: bspwm is a tiling window manager along the lines of qtile and i3 . The window manager, bspwm, does not handle any keyboard inputs and a third party program, sxhkd , is needed in order to translate keyboard events to navigate around bspwm. Most of my keyboard shortcuts are the default from ‘sxhkd’. However, there are a few additions which have made navigation much easier for me. 1. Rotate an application around the current desktop super + shift + {p,o} bspc node @/ -C {forward,backward} The keys ‘p’ and ‘o’ can be changed for whatever you prefer - they just work for me!
